result.execSummary:
The defendant Shane M Gwinn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shane M Gwinn is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Shane M Gwinn was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Shane M Gwinn was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Endanger Safety by Use of Dangerous Weapon (Discharge Firearm into Vehicle or Building)

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 10/23/2015 @ 1:30pm, Br-40

miscConds.notes: AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the DOC'. Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

- No firearms/weapons. Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
- Successfully complete Anger Management counseling. Continue programming with the clinic.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
- Pay all supervision fees as determined by the DOC's.
- Obtain/maintain employment.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent; with credit for 3 days time served

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shane M Gwinn in court.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Shane M Gwinn in court with attorney Dennis P Coffey.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered charge dismissed.  
.
AS TO COUNTS 2 AND 3:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
*
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days time served.  
.
AS TO COUNT 3:  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months concurrent in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days time served.  
.
COURT STAYED THE SENTENCES and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 10/23/15.
-Successfully complete Anger Management counseling.  Continue programming with the clinic.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-NO VIOLENT CONTACT with the victim rising to the level of probable cause for arrest.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Shane M Gwinn in court with attorney Dennis P Coffey.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for plea and sentencing.  Defense would like an adjournment so the defendant can complete more counselling.  Court granted the request.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shane M Gwinn in court with attorney Dennis P Coffey.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Statements made by Mindy G.  Court amended the no contact order to a No Violent Contact Order.  Parties cannot live together.

Defendant Shane M Gwinn in court with attorney Dennis P Coffey.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:  04/03/15.

04-03-15

Court ordered the remaining cash bail to be returned to the remitter.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MIndy G., K.V.G. (12-30-2007) and B.B.G. (8-14-2005.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Shane M Gwinn in court with attorney Dennis P Coffey.  Lovell Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. Defense enters a NOT GUILTY PLEA as to COUNTS 2 and 3.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 40.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/6/15 @ 1:30pm
